text: The 2005–06 Czech First League, known as the Gambrinus liga for sponsorship reasons, was the thirteenth season of top-tier football in the Czech Republic. ==Stadia and locations== ==League table== ==Top goalscorers== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- !1 |align="left"| Milan Ivana |align="left"|Slovácko |11 |- !rowspan="3"|2 |align="left"| Marek Kulič |align="left"|Mladá Boleslav |rowspan="3"|10 |- |align="left"| Karel Piták |align="left"|Slavia Prague |- |align="left"| Stanislav Vlček |align="left"|Slavia Prague |- !5 |align="left"| Horst Siegl |align="left"|Most |9 |- !rowspan="4"|6 |align="left"| Luboš Pecka |align="left"|Mladá Boleslav |rowspan="4"|8 |- |align="left"| Adam Varadi |align="left"|Baník Ostrava |- |align="left"| Rudolf Otepka |align="left"|Příbram |- |align="left"| Libor Došek |align="left"|Sparta Prague |} ==See also== * 2005–06 Czech Cup * 2005–06 Czech 2. Liga == References == * ČMFS statistics Category:Czech First League seasons Czech 1
title: 2005–06 Czech First League
